title: ht logo
content:
have gone back to playing with again. comments please!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ht3.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20120418214147/http:/typophile.com/files/ht3.png) | 38.18 KB |
author: htdesign

comments.content:
comments:

you're just playing ... so nothing can be wrong.

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Motion Graphics](http://web.archive.org/web/20120418214147/http:/www.solid-creative.com/motion.htm)
Thanks for that really constructive comment.
Of the 3 the top right is probably the most usable. However, I would consider using the logo separately from the mark.

why not offer some constructive insight into what you're TRYING to achieve.

happy to respond accordingly.

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20120418214147/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)

I am not sure where you are gonna use this logotype design, is it an agency logo design? I prefer the one on the top right with color combination of orange, cyan, light cocoa. it looks brighter and more attractive from a far distance.

good work!

Chriswong

I like the one on the top right, too, but, it reads "hit" to me. "Hit Design" really isn't that bad a name, though! I kinda like it.

I also think maybe it's stronger without the brown frame?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120418214147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ht3_4420.jpg)

Agreed. I like the colors and arrangement of the top right.

But like Eileen said I see hit. Even the the way the t seems to hit the h. It kind of works. Happy accident.
